channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+6671] This Is Apple's Next iPhone
item.description: You are looking at Apple's next iPhone. It was found lost in a Bar in Redwood City, camouflaged to look like an iPhone 3GS. We got it. We disassembled it. It's the real thing, and here are all the details:

item.title: [+2657] God Bless Texas (PIC)
item.description: Lucky for all of us, archery items are now in stock too!

item.title: [+2309] Karl Rove Slams Fox for Bringing Up Anti-Rove Protesters
item.description: Fox News contributor Karl Rove directed some unfriendly fire at the hosts of "Fox and Friends" this weekend when the show's anchors decided to ask Rove to respond to protesters who disrupted the former top Bush adviser's book tour.

item.title: [+2078] It's hard to say goodbye
[+2072] Is Piracy Really Killing The Music Industry? No!
item.description: For more than a decade the music industry has claimed that digital piracy is the main cause for the gradual decline in revenues. However, looking at the sales data of the music industry itself shows that the disappointing income might be better explained by a third factor that is systematically ignored.

item.title: [+1822] Redneck's knowledge about Islam
[+1739] The Pirate Bay, A Year After The Verdict
item.description: Exactly one year ago The Pirate Bay Four were sentenced to a year in prison, and on top of that each ordered to pay $905,000 in damages. The entertainment industries hoped that the ruling would set an example, but today The Pirate Bay is larger than ever before.

item.title: [+1659] xkcd: Laser Pointer
[+1530] Reagan’s Prayer Ritual Finally Ruled Unconstitutional
item.description: On Thursday, April 15, 2010, SR U.S. District Court Judge Barbara B. Crabb ruled that the National Day of Prayer Proclamation, instituted by Ronald Reagan in 1988, is unconstitutional. Freedom From Religion Foundation v George W. Bush was filed in Wisconsin in 2008 and has been progressing through the ...

item.title: [+1471] I had sushi tonight and I ordered a spider roll
item.description: This is what they brought me.

item.title: [+1469] Pop Songs Use the Same 4 Chords
item.description: Australian comedy group 'Axis Of Awesome' perform a sketch from the 2009 Melbourne International Comedy Festival.

item.title: [+1211] 11 Arrested Development Shout Outs To Its Actors' Past Roles
item.description: During its three seasons almost no one was safe from a shout out to their past -- cast members, guest stars and narrators/producers all got swept up in those nudges to the most hardcore fans.

item.title: [+1077] Google Chrome Ditches Http://
item.description: When you see some text prefixed by “Http://”, you automatically assume that what follows is a web address, as defined by the Hypertext Transfer Protocol. The question is, since most web addresses are easily recognizable anyway, do you really need it?

item.title: [+947] Iceland's Eyjafjallajokull Volcano Generates Lightning Bolts
[+883] Gizmodo paid $10,000 for "lost" iPhone 4G
item.description: The Internet is abuzz today with Gizmodo's hands on preview of what appears to be Apple's next-gen iPhone. Now word is leaking out that Gizmodo paid a cool 10 grand for the iPhone prototype, which all things considered, seems like a bargain given Apple’s typically tight reign on product leaks.

item.title: [+821] APOD: Ash and Lightning Above an Icelandic Volcano
item.description: Pictured two days ago, lightning bolts illuminate ash pouring out of the Eyjafjallajokull volcano.

item.title: [+816] SNL - Shake Weight Dvd
item.description: For people who can't get enough of the Shake Weight commercial. You know who you are.

item.title: [+799] User's Manifesto: Defense of hacking, modding, jailbreaking
item.description: There’s a trend that’s been disturbing me lately. When the topic of modding or jailbreaking comes up — say, in the wake of the iPad announcement, or Sony’s restrictive PS3 update — there is an outcry. Who am I to tell Apple what’s best for their devices? How can I in good conscience urge others to void their warranties or break license agreements?

item.title: [+684] Loyal Golden Retriever Stayed with Her Owner Until the End
item.description: Parley “Nick” Nichols took his deceased wife’s golden retriever, Lady, everywhere. The 81-year-old man was found dead in a swampy area about a mile from his home more than a week after he had been missing. The dog remained faithful, still by his side.

item.title: [+649] Man caught drunk driving in toy Barbie car
item.description: A father-of-four has been banned from driving for three years after getting behind the wheel of a toy car when drunk. Paul Hutton, 40, was over the legal alcohol limit when he climbed into the seat of a 4ft by 2ft electric Barbie car, which has a top speed of just 4mph.
